page.title: 01Norton and Lenchwick Index
page.content: This area containing the small villages of Norton and Lenchwick in Worcestershire is mainly rural.The land to the south is the flood plain of the river Avon.From this point a steep scarp rises with two prominent hills,Craycombe and Tunnel,these being wooded.From the top of the scarp the land continues to rise being given over to mainly arable and fruit farming. There is little habitation but one building,Wood Norton Hall,because of it's associations with the past and the present,has a fascinating story to tell. Road,river and rail communications link Evesham,Pershore and Worcester. These are all contained on and slightly above the flood plain of the river.
